devToolsConnectionError.message: Warning: This DevTools frame has become disconnected, probably due to the extension being reloaded. You'll need to reload this frame (e.g. via its context menu) for it to recieve updates again.

extensionDescription.message: Allows you to navigate a web page via WAI-ARIA landmarks, using the keyboard or a pop-up menu.

extensionFullName.message: Landmark Navigation via Keyboard or Pop-up

forbiddenPage.message: Landmarks is not allowed to run on this page.

lintAboutLinkText.message: All about landmark regions, and some golden rules (story and slides for my a11yTOConf talk)

lintAboutNature.message: Warnings given above are best practice suggestions: following them can significantly improve the experience of people using assistive technologies. These warnings are not necessarily Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) failures. However, using landmarks in a way that misrepresents the structure of the page can be a WCAG failure.

lintDuplicateUnlabelled.message: Duplicate unlabelled landmark with this role.

mainLandmarkShortcutDescription.message: Move to and highlight the main landmark

nextLandmarkShortcutDescription.message: Move to and highlight the next landmark

prefsClosePopupOnActivate.message: Close the pop-up immediately when activating a landmark button

prefsClosePopupOnActivateInfo.message: Instead of having to manually close the pop-up before continuing to navigate the page, turning this on closes the pop-up automatically.

prefsGuessLandmarks.message: Try to guess some landmarks if they're not provided

prefsGuessLandmarksInfo.message: If you're a developer or accessibility auditor, you may wish to disable this, as guessed landmarks are counted in the toolbar badge. Regardless of this setting, relevant warnings are always shown in the Landmarks DevTools side pane.

prefsHandleMutationsViaTreeInfo.message: Try out the under-development new way of handling changes on the page: changes are handled more efficiently, without a full-page scan, as soon as they arise. Eventually this will become the default, but only after the performance is tuned. It's likely that a back-off will be introduced, as with the current method of handling changes to the page.

previousLandmarkShortcutDescription.message: Move to and highlight the previous landmark

statsAverageDurationDefinition.message: Number of milliseconds the average landmark scan took.

statsCheckedMutationsDefinition.message: Mutations that Landmarks has tested to see if they are relevant (mutations that happen during a pause in scanning are ignored).

statsDurationDefinition.message: Number of milliseconds the last landmark scan took.

statsInfo.message: This info relates to how the extension is scanning the page for landmarks. When DevTools is open, the page will be scanned using the more detailed and slightly slower "developer" version of the scanner.

statsMutationScansDefinition.message: Number of times the page has been scanned for landmarks due to mutations. Includes scans triggered directly by mutations, as well as scans scheduled for after a pause brought on by multiple successive mutations.

statsMutationsDefinition.message: Total number of changes to the page.

statsNonMutationScansDefinition.message: Number of times the page has been scanned for landmarks for other reasons, such as: page load; use of History API; user command whilst scanning is paused due to prior mutations.

statsPauseDefinition.message: Time window during which subsequent changes to the page will be ignored.

toggleAllShortcutDescription.message: Toggle the display of all landmarks on the page
